results.title: J'accuse
results.brief_description: J’accuse is a series designed to provoke and stimulate discussion as each episode critically examines the work of famous artists, writers, composers and filmmakers.

results.title: Once upon a time in America
results.creator_credit: Sergio Leone, Arnon Milchan and Embassy International Pictures
results.brief_description: Crime, passion and a lust for power - an explosive saga of gangland America. Its extraordinary craftsmanship, together with its exceptional levels of acting and storytelling, place it among such other R-rated classics as “The Deerhunter”, “The Godfather”, “Midnight Express” and “A Clockwork Orange”. Stars Robert de Niro, James Woods, Elizabeth McGovern, Danny Aiello, Joe Pesci and Tuesday Weld.

results.title: Van Gogh
results.creator_credit: Gary Johnstone, Channel Four and Fulmar
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “J’accuse”.
Was Vincent Van Gogh a genius or a clumsy amateur? Art historian, Griselda Pollock presents a critical and provocative look at the life and work of this celebrated artist and examines some of the myths. Van Gogh is popularly perceived as a tragic but inspirational figure who was unappreciated during his life, but has since become one of the most famous artists of all time. Pollock tries to separate the facts from the legend and shows how powerful mass media and the art market have been in shaping our attitude towards art and artists.

results.title: Once upon a prime time
results.creator_credit: Bernard Devlin, David Bairstow and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A zany spoof with plenty of violence borrowed from the very source it seeks to parody, this film is about a housewife who has lost her family to the television set. Characters spring from the screen to invade her home and take over her life. She is saved by Buck the cowboy, who shoots everyone dead and rides off with her. Sam, her husband, witnesses the departure on his TV set. Stars: Edward Allen, Paul Berval, Christien Delmas, Basil Fitzgibbon, Gilles Pellerin, Joan Stuart, John Vernon, Chris Wiggins, Trudi Wiggins, Leslie Yeo, Ted Zeigler. Written by Stan Daniels; photographed by Jean Roy and Thomas Vamos; edited by Kathleen Shannon; sound by Ron Alexander, Andre Hourlier, John Knight and Roger Lamoureux.

results.title: Once upon a mouse
results.creator_credit: Gary Rocklen, Jerry Kramer and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: Excerpts from animated features, cartoon shorts and still photography are combined for a nostalgic montage of unusual beauty and emotional impact. The film segments a wide variety of Disney animated features, such as music, love, villains and happy endings.

results.title: J'ai Epouse Une Ombre = I Married a Dead Man
results.brief_description:
Helene is 8 months pregnant when she is abandoned by Frank, her companion. Lonely and desperate she boards the first train heading south. Aboard, she meets vineyard heir Bertrand Meyrand and his wife Patricia, also 8 months pregnant. During the night, the train is derailed. Bertrand and Patricia die during the accident. When Helene wakes up at the hospital, she realises that everyone mistakes her for Patricia, including Bertrand’s parents who offer her shelter at their wine growing property. Helene settles uncomfortably in her new family, until the day Frank comes back to blackmail her. The plot is based on a story by Cornell Woolrich and was filmed twice before as ‘No Man of Her Own’ in 1932 and 1949 in the U.S.A. In 1996 it was remade again as the romantic comedy ‘Mrs. Winterbourne’.

Credits: Producer, Alain Sarde ; director, Robin Davis ; writers, Robin Davis, Patrick Laurent ; photography, Bernard Zitzerman ; music, Philippe Sarde.
Cast: Nathalie Baye, Francis Huster, Richard Bohringer, Madeleine Robinson, Guy Trejean, Victoria Abril, Veronique Genest.

results.title: Once upon a midnight scary
results.creator_credit: Neil Cox, Paul Asselin and Diane Asselin
results.brief_description: Welcome to the eerie library of Vincent Price, journey with him into a world of ghosts, ghouls and “things that go bump in the night”. The Master of macabre has conjured up a reading of classic and contemporary ghost stories that are vividly brought to life. There is mystery and wonder in these three famous tales of the supernatural. In Richard Peck’s “The Ghost Belonged to Me”, meet 13 year old Alexander, a farmboy who discovers he has his very own ghost! And see Ichabod Crane from Washington Irving’s classic “The Legend of Sleepy Hollow”, who doesn’t believe in ghosts - until the Headless Horseman takes his last ride. Then there’s John Bellair’s “The House With a Clock in its Walls”, where a doctor and his nephew race against an evil spirit to find a clock before it destroys the world.

results.title: Iwerre Atherrame: two paths
results.creator_credit: Kwementyaye (David) Vadiveloo, Australian Film Commission, Victorian College of the Arts and Achilles Heel
results.brief_description: The sometimes cruel but often beautiful landscape of Alice Springs is looked at from a different perspective in this confronting documentary. Focussing on four school children who have been rejected from the mainstream educational system, this film looks at the Detour Project, which is an alternative schooling initiative set up for Aboriginal children who have not benefitted form the education offered in the mainstream system. It offers a curriculum both in Arrente and English, it preserves the traditional language and culture of the people of Alice Springs and recognises the importance of culture, belonging and a sense of place. It is a journey of hope, simply told but with a savage twist.

results.title: Once upon a hunt [Dubbed]
results.creator_credit: Francis Mankiewicz, Pierre Gauvreau and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This feature film is the story of three men and a boy who leave the city for the bush and a three-day hunt. For the hunters escaping the routine of daily life and work, the hunt is a move towards freedom. And above all, it is a chance to prove their virility in conquering the wild. Their attempts end in failure and tragedy. Cast includes Monique Mercure, Francoise Berd, Marcel Sabourin, Frederique Collin, Pierre Dufresne. Preview before screening for a general audience. Dubbed English version. (Award: Toronto)

results.title: Modern bread making
results.creator_credit: Jack Gardiner, Peter Whitchurch and Kingcroft Productions
results.brief_description: The whole process of bread making in a highly mechanised factory. Weighing and mixing the ingredients, the bread rising, mechanical cutting, moulding and oil spraying of the loaves; baking, slicing, wrapping and despatch. Presented by the bakers of Tip Top Bread.
